traceability.evidence: • src/cli-options-helpers.js implements parseProdMinAgeFlag, parseDevMinAgeFlag, parseProdSeverityFlag, parseDevSeverityFlag with full validation (unit‐tested in test/cli-options-helpers.test.js) • src/cli-options.js wires those helpers into parseOptions, merging CLI flags, config file (config-loader.js) and defaults • config-loader.js supports nested prod/dev blocks and validates config.prod.minAge/minSeverity and config.dev.minAge/minSeverity (verified in test/cli.config-file.test.js) • print-outdated.js uses getDependencyType against package.json and injects a “Type” column in table output (verified in test/printOutdated.prodDependency.test.js) • Fallback and default behavior: --prod-min-age/--dev-min-age fall back to --min-age, and both fall back to default 7 if no flags or config (verified in test/cli.flags.test.js) • Output formatting (table/json/xml) carries thresholds and dependencyType for prod/dev (covered by tests in test/printOutdated.* and xml/json‐formatter tests) • All 128 Vitest tests pass (per project’s current cycle test report)
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for story 007.0 (new CLI flags, config support, dependency‐type awareness, fallback/defaults, validation, output) are satisfied with concrete tests and implementation. Performance of precedence (nested config vs general flags) aligns with the defined fallback semantics.
